title: Last Hope
opening: The Sacred Stone of Renais has been broken. Constant strife with dark creatures has made the group’s progress near impossible. Princess L'Arachel of Rausten suggests they pay a visit to Rausten Court. It is here that the final Sacred Stone is sealed away. L’Arachel rides cheerfully toward her homeland with the company in tow.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Home at last. My dear, sweet palace. Uncle, I’ve returned.

intro.speaker: Mansel
intro.line: Oh, L’Arachel! It’s good to see you safe!

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Of course I’m safe, Uncle. Evil can never defeat the forces of righteousness!

intro.speaker: Mansel
intro.line: Ha! You’re exactly right, my dear! Now tell me, who are our guests?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Pontifex Mansel of Rausten, allow me to introduce myself. I am Eirika, Princess of Renais. I come to you today as an emissary of Frelia.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: And I am Ephraim, Prince of Renais. I come with Eirika to warn you of the danger our world faces.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: It began when...

intro.speaker: Mansel
intro.line: ...Hmm, I see. That is a tough tale to swallow all at once... However, I have heard of the fell creatures in Darkling Woods. L’Arachel. You will need the Stone of Rausten if we have any hope of victory.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: That is so, Uncle. I would like permission to open the temple seal.

intro.speaker: Mansel
intro.line: Hmm... There's no need to rush yourself so, L'Arachel. You’re home again, in this blessed haven. You should rest.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: How can I relax until I know that our Sacred Stone is safe? At the least, I’d like to ensure that the temple seal is intact. Oh...

intro.speaker: Mansel
intro.line: Is something amiss?

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: I think we’ll take a night to rest after all. Everyone is so exhausted. My dear friend Eirika especially has had a very trying time of late.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Eirika.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Ah...

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Don’t look so sad. It wreaks such havoc on your beauty.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: L'Arachel. I... What should I do? Lyon was one of my dearest friends... I feel so helpless. There’s nothing I can do to help him...

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Your friend is gone, Eirika. All that remains is the Demon King, masquerading as Lyon. For the good of all humanity, he must be defeated. Ah... If only it truly were that easy, though.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Eirika... I never knew Prince Lyon. I cannot pretend to understand the sadness you must feel. However, I do know this... If the Lyon you hold so dear were here with you today... What do you think he would want you to do?

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: There’s no need to rush, Eirika. Take your time and think it through. You need to find your own answer. Now then, it’s about time we found ourselves something to eat. It’s hard to be optimistic on an empty stomach.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Yes, I’ll be right there. Thank you, L'Arachel.

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: Come on, Ephraim, cheer up.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: What are you talking about, Tana? There's nothing wrong with me. I'm always like this.

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: That's not true. I've never seen you look so sad as you do right now. If you're depressed, I'm sure my brother would worry... And I...well, I...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: ......Tana. You're the princess of Frelia. Perhaps it's unwise of you to be so friendly to Eirika and me. After all, alliances aside, our two countries' needs may differ. Who knows what the future holds? Those ties could snap in an instant...

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: No! Don't say that!

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: And why not?

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: You and Eirika are both my friends. We come from different countries, it's true, but...but... No matter what happens, the friendship I feel for you will never change!

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: ......I'm sorry, Tana. I wasn't thinking straight. Please don't cry.

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: Ephraim...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: You're right, though. No matter what happens, the bond between us will never disappear. And it's because Lyon is my friend that I have to put an end to this. Thank you, Tana.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: That long face doesn't suit you at all. Has something happened?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: L'Arachel... No, this is how I always am.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Lying to the daughter of a holy man is a grave sin, don't you know? If you would like to talk, I would like to listen...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: ......I'm sorry. I can't talk about it. I'm not even planning on telling Eirika what happened.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: You're so stubborn, aren't you? Do you plan on shouldering the entire burden yourself?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: I'm sorry.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: If that's all you're going to say, then there's naught I can do. Have you already decided on your course of action?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: ......Mm-hm. I'm prepared.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: ...Then there's no need for me to say anything more, is there? You and I are so alike... You want nothing but to help others. You refuse to show weakness, and you want to accomplish everything yourself. However, you must know that there are times when you must share the burden.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: That's true... And I feel better for having spoken with you. Thank you, L'Arachel.
Heh heh heh... Guard duty? At this time of night? Such a diligent soldier.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Huh?! Who goes there?
Where are you looking? I’m over here.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Wha...
No, no, here. I’m over here.
What’s wrong? I’m right here. Heh heh heh...

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Wha...wha...
Is the darkness too deep for you to penetrate? Can’t you see what the night is hiding?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: A-attack!

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Heh heh heh... Humans will never conquer darkness. The guardian of light, Rausten, will drown in a never-ending night. Come, my pretties. It’s time to go. The day of Rausten’s destruction has at long last arrived!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Your Holiness! There’s been an attack! We think it’s Grado’s men, fleeing from Frelia’s forces. However, they’ve breached the palace defenses at multiple points.

intro.speaker: Mansel
intro.line: What?!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: The imperial guard is at a terrible disadvantage of numbers right now. It’s less a battle than a slaughter. I’m not sure they will be able to hold out until the Knights of Rausten arrive.

intro.speaker: Mansel
intro.line: How has this happened? Our sacred capital invaded? I must...

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Uncle, please, you must keep yourself safe. We can take care of this. Is everyone ready to go?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Princess Eirika, please... Prince Ephraim and I will handle this.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Seth, it’s all right. Eirika can take care of herself. Isn’t that right, Eirika?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Yes. I’m sorry if I troubled you. Let’s go. We have to protect Pontifex Mansel.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Prince Ephraim, we’ll take care of this. Please…

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Brother...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: I’m sorry. I’ve been useless and worse lately. I’m over it now. I’m ready to fight. Let’s go! Take out the enemy, and protect Pontifex Mansel!

battle.speaker: Riev
battle.line: Heh heh heh... The day is coming, and swiftly... The day of our triumph, our vengeance! Self-righteous fools of Rausten! Where are your miracles now?! March on! March, minions of the Demon King! Your time is upon you! Tonight, we claim not only Pontifex Mansel’s sad life, but also Rausten’s Sacred Stone! Heh heh heh... You cretin, Mansel... I will have my revenge. You should never have excommunicated me. The Demon King will be your new master!

battle.speaker: Eirika
battle.line: Lyon... You were so selfless. Your generosity seemed to flow from a bottomless well. I’m so sorry, Lyon. I couldn’t save you. But I know what you would have wanted. I know it as I know my own name. So watch, Lyon. I will defeat the Demon King.

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Lyon is my friend. No matter what has happened, that one fact will not change. I know this. I will not falter in my resolve. Lyon, because I’m your friend, I will strike you down.

boss.speaker: Riev
boss.line: Heh heh heh... One Sacred Stone remains. Once it is destroyed, darkness will consume the world. What will you do? Will you cower in fear? Heh heh heh...

boss.speaker: Riev
boss.line: Heh heh heh... No! No! It’s been so long. I got carried away. I’d best stop and withdraw for now. Follow me. Come to Darkling Woods… The Demon King awaits your pleasure...

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: Behold. Victory is ours!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes, we did it somehow. I wonder if everyone else is OK.

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: Eirika? Did you find your answer?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes. Thank you, L’Arachel. Your words guided me.

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: My-my words? It was nothing... Come, we should find the Sacred Stone. If anything were to happen to it...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: L'Arachel? Your face is flushed. Is anything amiss?”

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: N-no, it’s nothing. Nothing at all!”

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: That takes care of that.

end.speaker: Tana
end.line: Ephraim! I’d glad to see that your spirits are up.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Ah, Tana. And I have you to thank for it.

end.speaker: Tana
end.line: It was nothing. As long as you’re back to your old self, that is thanks enough.

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: I’m holding it in my very hand! The Stone of Rausten! Its glorious radiance suits my complexion, wouldn’t you say?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: This is it. The last one. The last remaining Sacred Stone.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: It is. And the time to defeat the Demon King draws near.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: We should be leaving. We have to act before those creatures gain more momentum.

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: Yes. We should make haste. The poison spreads. It is growing ever stronger.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Where?

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: Darkling Woods... Where the Demon King fell...

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: L'Arachel, must you leave so soon? You’ve only just returned, and you have to leave?

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: Uncle, defeating evil is the highest calling I can perform.

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: Of course, my dear. It is a divine calling, but...

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: You needn’t worry, Uncle. After all, I'm not on my own. I have my friends.

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: I see. You’ve been blessed, L'Arachel. Blessed with many good friends.

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: I am indeed, Uncle. And they, in turn, are blessed with me! Farewell, Uncle. I shall return. Once evil has been vanquished, we'll all return safe and sound.

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: Hold on. Not so fast now.

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: I have something I wish to present to Princess Eirika.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: To me, Your Holiness?

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: Yes, Princess. I'd like you to accept this gift.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: Oh! Aren't those... Aren't those the Sacred Twins of Rausten?

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: That's right, dear niece. These are the weapons of Saint Latona, most holy father of Rausten. Here, we have glorious Ivaldi, and its twin, the divine Staff of Latona. I will also spare some funding to feed and arm your forces. After all, there is much that you must do before you leave these halls.

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: So they are the blessed Latona's most sacred relics... Is this allowed?

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: I know the law, L'Arachel. The relics must never leave the temple, with the sole exception of the occasional ascension ceremony, but I think that, when the world needs saving, we can make the odd exception.

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: That's my uncle!

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: You will return them, of course... once you've finished your task. Princess Eirika, I would have your oath on this.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Of course. You have my word. We shall return safely, and we shall restore your relics.

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: Darkling Woods is home to naught but demons now. Indeed, I hear tell that none who enter its borders ever leave again. We ought to stock up on supplies in town before we set out.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes, we must be as prepared as possible before we set out. I don't want to take any reckless chances with our lives.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Princess L'Arachel!

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: My beloved countrymen! The combat was fierce, but you protected the palace honorably. The valorous Knights of Rausten shall live on in story and song!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Thank you, my lady. As always, it is our honor to serve. Princess Eirika, before you leave, please take this sword. We pray for your swift and safe return!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I appreciate your gift. I swear I will not allow your valor to be wasted!

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: As long as the righteousness of justice fills our hearts, how can we lose? Men, I ask that you watch after my dear uncle.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: You have our word, my lady. In the twin names of justice and order!

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: I have something else for Prince Ephraim as well.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: For me?

end.speaker: Mansel
end.line: That's right, Prince. I'd like you to accept this gift.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: But this is...

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: Oh! Aren't those... Aren't those the Sacred Twins of Rausten?

end.speaker: Mansel

I will also spare some funding to feed and arm your forces. After all, there is much that you must do before you leave these halls.

end.line: So they are the blessed Latona's most sacred relics... Is this allowed?

end.line: I know the law, L'Arachel. The relics must never leave the temple, with the sole exception of the occasional ascension ceremony, but I think that, when the world needs saving, we can make the odd exception.

end.line: That's my uncle!

end.speaker: Mansel

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Of course.

end.speaker: L'Arachel

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Yes, I think stocking up would be in our best interest. I intended to see that we all return unharmed.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Princess L'Arachel!

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: My beloved countrymen! The combat was fierce, but you protected the palace honorably. The valorous Knights of Rausten shall live on in story and song!

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: As I pray for your safety, too. I won't let your valorous deeds be wasted this day!
